maml:description.maml:para: Clears a tag from Media File.
The Clear-Tag cmdlet deletes all entries inside the specified tag.
Writes the tag of target media file into pipe after processing.
Path to media file.
Show all verbose messages.
In WhatIf mode, changes to tags are not written to disk, but done in cache. Use Save-Tag or Reset-Tag or Clear-TagCache to handle changes.
Writes the tag of target media file into pipe after processing.
The target tag.
Show all verbose messages.
In WhatIf mode, changes to tags are not written to disk, but done in cache. Use Save-Tag or Reset-Tag or Clear-TagCache to handle changes.
Writes the tag of target media file into pipe after processing.
Path to media file.
Show all verbose messages.
In WhatIf mode, changes to tags are not written to disk, but done in cache. Use Save-Tag or Reset-Tag or Clear-TagCache to handle changes.
The target tag.
You can pipe a string that contains a path to Clear-Tag. You can pipe a tag to Clear-Tag.
This cmdlet does not return any output by default. If -PassThru is used, the cleared Tag will be returned.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Clears the tag from 'test.mp3'.
Clears the tag from 'test.mp3' and pipes the empty tag.
Title Artists Album Filename ----- ------- ----- -------- {} test.mp3
Clears all tags from files in current location.

maml:description.maml:para: Clears the internal tag cache.

PowerTag stores references to touched tags inside an internal cache. Changes done to tags, using -WhatIf are not written to disk, but changed in memory. Later calls of Get-Tag will return the modified (but not stored) values (use -force to not use cache). Clearing the cache will discard all unwritten changes.
This CmdLet does not take input parameter.
This CmdLet does not return any object.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example clears the internal tag cache.

maml:description.maml:para: Extracts the pure album text.
This CmdLet extracts a single information (the album) from media's tag and returns this as String.
Show all verbose messages.
Path to media file or directory.
Show all verbose messages.
Tag that's album will be extracted.
Show all verbose messages.
Show all verbose messages.
Path to media file or directory.
Tag that's album will be extracted.
If a String is given, it must point to a file or directory. If neither Path nor Tag is given, all tags from current directory will be performed.
the album

maml:alert.maml:para: This is a wrapper CmdLet for Get-Tag.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This sample displays the album for every media file in current location.
bar baz
This sample displays the album from media file 'test.mp3'
bar
This example lists all unique album titles from mediafiles in current location and child directories.
bar baz

maml:description.maml:para: Returns a list of all genres, known by the library.

This CmdLet returns a list of known genres. If neither -Audio nor -Video is set, all genres will be returned.
This CmdLet does not search your media files for genres, but queries a static list. Use 'Get-Tag | Format-Table Genres' to get a list of used genres.
Return only audio genres.
Return only video genres.
Return only genres, that match the filter.
Return only audio genres.
Return only video genres.
Return only genres, that match the filter.
This CmdLet does not take any input.
A flat list of genre names.

maml:alert.maml:para: Feel free to use any genre name you like, but this is the 'official' list.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example lists all known genres.
Action Action/Adventure Adult Adventure ... Anime Jpop Synthpop
This example lists all known video genres.
Action Action/Adventure Adult Adventure ... Splatter Sports Thriller Western
This example lists all known audio genres.
Blues Classic Rock Country ... Salsa Thrash Metal Anime Jpop Synthpop

This example lists all unique generes from mediafiles in current location and child directories.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns a list of all media files.

This CmdLet returns all media files at given or current location. It does not return a tag, but FileInfo objects (like Get-ChildItem), so you can pipe the result into normal buildin powershell Commands. If used on a single file, the file will be tested and returned, if it has a valid media extension.
If set, also child directories will be scaned.
Path to file or directory.
If set, also child directories will be scaned.
Path to file or directory.
Path to a file or directory.

maml:alert.maml:para: Mediafiles are detected by their extension.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example lists all media files in current location.
This example shows, how to do normal powershell voodoo and pipe the result into Get-Mediafile to select only media files and copy them into one single folder.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns the tag from a media file.
The Get-Tag CmdLet extracts the meta information from media files. If performed on an directory, it returns all tags from contained media files.
If set and FileName points to a directory, Get-Tag will also return all tags from media files in child direcotries.
If set, only tags that Title match the filter, will be returned.
If set, only tags that Artist match the filter, will be returned.
If set, only tags that Album match the filter, will be returned.
If set, TagCache will not be used.
If set and FileName points to a directory, Get-Tag will also return all tags from media files in child direcotries.
If set, only tags that Title match the filter, will be returned.
If set, only tags that Artist match the filter, will be returned.
If set, only tags that Album match the filter, will be returned.
If set, TagCache will not be used.
Path to media file or directory.
the tag of the media file

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns all Tags from media files in current directory.
Title Artists Album Filename ----- ------- ----- -------- Test title {foo} bar test.mp3 second title {bar} baz test2.mp3
Returns all Tags from media files in current directory, that's title start with 't'.
Title Artists Album Filename ----- ------- ----- -------- Test title {foo} bar test.mp3
